intro: Scabiosa poecilocarpa, commonly known as the candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pink flowers that resemble candy drops, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa poecilocarpa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
